{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3428572,"name":"Juan Chong","username":"juchong","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/juchong/{size}/150488_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-28T06:52:45.101Z","cooked":"

Hi folks, it looks like none of the FRC tools (FRC Driver Station or WPILib) currently support ARM. Is there any way that we can get this fixed/updated for next season? It’s 2024 and both MacOS and Windows have solid ARM support on their respective platforms.

The screenshot attached below shows the error that the driver station software throws when run on a Windows 11 PC running on an ARM processor.

CC: @Thad_House @Peter_Johnson

Screenshot 2024-09-27 2337522878×1798 758 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-09-28T06:52:45.101Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":389,"reads":351,"readers_count":350,"score":2015.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":472062,"topic_slug":"arm-support-for-frc-tools","display_username":"Juan Chong","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/50-fun-ways-to-lose-a-match/481954/415","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"50 Fun Ways to Lose a Match","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10665,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Motion Sensor Hardware Engineer @ Reality Labs (Meta)"},"post_url":"/t/arm-support-for-frc-tools/472062/1","custom_user_title":"Motion Sensor Hardware Engineer @ Reality Labs (Meta)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3428574,"name":"neev dadhania","username":"nevadexehs","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ecc23a/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-28T06:55:24.941Z","cooked":"

FRC Driver Station will never support ARM since its written by NI.

In theory, WPILib should be able to be built for ARM since it already have linux arm binaries.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-09-28T06:55:24.941Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":312,"readers_count":311,"score":137.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":472062,"topic_slug":"arm-support-for-frc-tools","display_username":"neev dadhania","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57670,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"204 programmer + electrical"},"post_url":"/t/arm-support-for-frc-tools/472062/2","custom_user_title":"204 programmer + electrical","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3428575,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-28T06:59:16.843Z","cooked":"

We have supported Apple Silicon since last year (although SmartDashboard isn’t available on it). Windows ARM is still missing some bits (notably JavaFX applications like Shuffleboard, and C++ compilation); we plan to eventually support it, but I’m not sure we will get there for 2025. Note even after we add support, simulation support will still be up to vendors.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-09-28T15:08:54.174Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":304,"readers_count":303,"score":110.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":472062,"topic_slug":"arm-support-for-frc-tools","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/arm-support-for-frc-tools/472062/3","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3428576,"name":"Carlos Gross Jones","username":"CarlosGJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/carlosgj/{size}/131747_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-28T07:11:40.340Z","cooked":"

It’d be nice, but I doubt that ARM support is high on anyone’s priority list, simply because no one makes ARM machines suitable for serious work; the only “desktop” (non-embedded-control) ARM things that I can think of are Raspberry Pis and Apples.

It’s the same basic catch-22 as Linux CAD software: no one wants to leave Windows because there isn’t any CAD software that runs on Linux, and the CAD software vendors don’t want to invest in supporting Linux because there’s no customer base.

This is great, but the elephant in the room is still the driver station software. Can you DM me Greg’s e-mail?

Most of the applications you use every day were built using *nix-based workstations. Most notably, ARM-based MacBooks.

…yes?

My whole lab-- embedded controllers, servers, and consoles-- runs some variant of Debian.

It’s all x86_64/amd64, though. The OS isn’t actually tied to a specific architecture, generally. You can get Debian for i386, x86_64, arm, ppc, etc. Unfortunately, while relatively simple programs can be cross-compiled pretty trivially, more complex things (especially those involving parallel processing or graphics) have to be manually tailored to each architecture. Since development effort, by and large, follows customer base, anything related to engineering is probably going to support Windows first, and maybe Linux, on x86_64/amd64 either way. Support for more niche/hobbyist OSs (BSD, Apple, ChromeOS) and architectures (ARM, SPARC, i386) is left to the community, if it happens at all.

CarlosGJ:

simply because no one makes ARM machines suitable for serious work; the only “desktop” (non-embedded-control) ARM things that I can think of are Raspberry Pis and Apples.

This is not true. Think of all the “AI PCs” running Snapdragon X chips being released in the last year. Besides, almost every consumer mobile phone is based on ARM architecture (not WPILib should support that, but they exist).

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-09-28T10:58:52.408Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":216,"readers_count":215,"score":48.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":472062,"topic_slug":"arm-support-for-frc-tools","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64857,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"246 Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/arm-support-for-frc-tools/472062/9","custom_user_title":"246 Software Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3428632,"name":"Greg McKaskle","username":"Greg_McKaskle","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/3da27b/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-28T14:11:24.335Z","cooked":"

The dialog shown in the initial post indicates that the runtime doesn’t recognize the “x86” vendor and therefore is not sure if we may have included instructions that are incompatible. That is why SSE is mentioned.

2024 release of LabVIEW includes the new vendor ID that MS uses for emulation on ARM. I’ve tested that the DS works. I’m doing this using Parallels on Apple and at least in that configuration, the USBLan driver is not loading and some dependencies of the vision libraries used by the dashboard are not loading.

This is being worked on, but it is too early to announce official support. The beta testing starts soon and will determine updates to the officially supported computers/OSes.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":18,"updated_at":"2024-09-28T14:11:24.335Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":201,"readers_count":200,"score":190.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":472062,"topic_slug":"arm-support-for-frc-tools","display_username":"Greg McKaskle","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":7}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10510,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/arm-support-for-frc-tools/472062/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":7}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":7,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3428709,"name":"tkchan","username":"tkchan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/ee59a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-28T20:53:13.014Z","cooked":"

so you want ppl to spend a ton of effort for a control system that is going to be changed in 2027 when there are so many other higher requested item that would benefit far more teams (and students)? and with the 2025 right around the corner?

Thanks for the update, Greg. I think basic DS operation on ARM is still a win since it enables full-stack development on recent MacOS hardware.

CarlosGJ:

simply because no one makes ARM machines suitable for serious work; the only “desktop” (non-embedded-control) ARM things that I can think of are Raspberry Pis and Apples.

FRC Tools isn’t “serious work” that needs a heavy duty desktop. It’s meant to be run on portable laptops, which are increasingly ARM based.
